method.name: POST
method.doc: Uploads a photo. Uploading apps can call the flickr.people.getUploadStatus method in the regular API to obtain file and bandwidth limits for the user.

param.name: title
param.doc: The title of the photo. Optional.

param.name: description
param.doc: A description of the photo. May contain some limited HTML. Optional.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-seperated list of tags to apply to the photo. Optional.

param.name: is_public
param.doc: Set to 0 for no, 1 for yes. Specifies who can view the photo. Optional.

param.name: is_friend
param.doc: Set to 0 for no, 1 for yes. Specifies who can view the photo. Optional.

param.name: is_family
param.doc: Set to 0 for no, 1 for yes. Specifies who can view the photo. Optional.

param.name: safety_level
param.doc: Set to 1 for Safe, 2 for Moderate, or 3 for Restricted. Optional.

param.name: content_type
param.doc: Set to 1 for Photo, 2 for Screenshot, or 3 for Other. Optional.

param.name: hidden
param.doc: Set to 1 to keep the photo in global search results, 2 to hide from public searches. Optional.

param.name: async
param.doc: Flickr can process photos in async mode, for applications that need to post multiple photos and don't want to wait around for each one to complete, leaving a socket connection open the whole time. Set to 1 for async mode, 0 for sync mode.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Replaces a photo that has already been uploaded to Flickr. Uploading apps can call the flickr.people.getUploadStatus method in the regular API to obtain file and bandwidth limits for the user.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The ID of the photo to replace.

param.name: async
param.doc: Photos may be replaced in async mode, for applications that don't want to wait around for an upload to complete, leaving a socket connection open the whole time. Processing photos asynchronously is recommended. Please consult the documentation for details. Set to 1 for async mode, 0 for sync mode.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of recent activity on photos commented on by the calling user. Do not poll this method more than once an hour.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of items to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 10. The maximum allowed value is 50.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: GET

param.doc: The timeframe in which to return updates for. This can be specified in days ('2d') or hours ('4h'). The default behavoir is to return changes since the beginning of the previous user session.

param.doc: Number of items to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 10. The maximum allowed value is 50.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.doc: The ID of the photo to blog.

param.doc: The blog post body.

param.doc: A Flickr supported blogging service. Instead of passing a blog id you can pass a service id and we'll post to the first blog of that service we find.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get a list of contacts for the calling user.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: filter
param.doc: An optional filter of the results. The following values are valid: friends (Only contacts who are friends, and not family), family (Only contacts who are family, and not friends), both (Only contacts who are both friends and family), neither (Only contacts who are neither friends nor family).

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1000. The maximum allowed value is 1000.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Return a list of contacts for a user who have recently uploaded photos along with the total count of photos uploaded. This method is still considered experimental. We don't plan for it to change or to go away but so long as this notice is present you should write your code accordingly.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: date_lastupload
param.doc: Limits the resultset to contacts that have uploaded photos since this date. The date should be in the form of a Unix timestamp. The default offset is (1) hour and the maximum (24) hours.

param.name: filter
param.doc: Limit the result set to all contacts or only those who are friends or family. Valid options are: ff (friends and family), all (all your contacts). Default value is "all".

param.doc: Minimum date that a photo was favorited on. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: max_fave_date
param.doc: Maximum date that a photo was favorited on. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get a list of the members of a group. The call must be signed on behalf of a Flickr member, and the ability to see the group membership will be determined by the Flickr member's group privileges.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.doc: Return a list of members for this group. The group must be viewable by the Flickr member on whose behalf the API call is made.

param.name: membertypes
param.doc: Comma separated list of member types. Accepted values: 2 (member), 3 (moderator), 4 (admin). By default returns all types. (Returning super rare member type "1: narwhal" isn't supported by this API method)

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of groups to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Return photos from the given user's photostream. Only photos visible to the calling user will be returned. This method must be authenticated; to return public photos for a user, use flickr.people.getPublicPhotos.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The NSID of the user whose photos to return. A value of "me" will return the calling user's photos.

param.name: safe_search
param.doc: Safe search setting. Accepted values: 1 (safe), 2 (moderate), 3 (restricted)

param.name: min_upload_date
param.doc: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: max_upload_date
param.doc: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: min_taken_date
param.doc: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

param.name: max_taken_date
param.doc: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

param.name: content_type
param.doc: Content type setting. Accepted values: 1 (photos only), 2 (screenshots only), 3 ('other' only), 4 (photos and screenshots), 5 (screenshots and 'other'), 6 (photos and 'other'), 7 (photos, screenshots, and 'other') (all)

param.name: privacy_filter
param.doc: Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. This only applies when making an authenticated call to view photos you own. Valid values are: 1 (public photos), 2 (private photos visible to friends), 3 (private photos visible to family), 4 (private photos visible to friends and family), 5 (completely private photos)

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.doc: Number of photos to return. Defaults to 10, maximum 50. This is only used if single_photo is not passed.

param.name: just_friends
param.doc: Set as 1 to only show photos from friends and family (excluding regular contacts).

param.name: single_photo
param.doc: Only fetch one photo (the latest) per contact, instead of all photos in chronological order.

param.name: include_self
param.doc: Set to 1 to include photos from the calling user.

param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields include: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update. For more information see extras under flickr.photos.search.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Return a list of your photos that have been recently created or which have been recently modified. Recently modified may mean that the photo's metadata (title, description, tags) may have been changed or a comment has been added (or just modified somehow :-)

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: min_date
param.doc: A Unix timestamp or any English textual datetime description indicating the date from which modifications should be compared.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Remove a tag from a photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to add tags to.

param.name: tag_id
param.doc: The tag to remove from the photo. This parameter should contain a tag id, as returned by flickr.photos.getInfo.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Return a list of photos matching some criteria. Only photos visible to the calling user will be returned. To return private or semi-private photos, the caller must be authenticated with 'read' permissions, and have permission to view the photos. Unauthenticated calls will only return public photos.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The NSID of the user who's photo to search. If this parameter isn't passed then everybody's public photos will be searched. A value of "me" will search against the calling user's photos for authenticated calls.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of tags. Photos with one or more of the tags listed will be returned. You can exclude results that match a term by prepending it with a - character.

param.name: tag_mode
param.doc: Either 'any' for an OR combination of tags, or 'all' for an AND combination. Defaults to 'any' if not specified.

param.name: text
param.doc: A free text search. Photos whose title, description or tags contain the text will be returned. You can exclude results that match a term by prepending it with a - character.

param.name: min_upload_date
param.doc: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a unix timestamp or mysql datetime.

param.name: max_upload_date
param.doc: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a unix timestamp or mysql datetime.

param.name: min_taken_date
param.doc: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a mysql datetime or unix timestamp.

param.name: max_taken_date
param.doc: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a mysql datetime or unix timestamp.

param.name: license
param.doc: The license id for photos (for possible values see the flickr.photos.licenses.getInfo method). Multiple licenses may be comma-separated.

param.name: sort
param.doc: The order in which to sort returned photos. Deafults to date-posted-desc (unless you are doing a radial geo query, in which case the default sorting is by ascending distance from the point specified). The possible values are: date-posted-asc, date-posted-desc, date-taken-asc, date-taken-desc, interestingness-desc, interestingness-asc, and relevance.

param.name: privacy_filter
param.doc: Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. This only applies when making an authenticated call to view photos you own. Valid values are: 1 (public photos), 2 (private photos visible to friends), 3 (private photos visible to family), 4 (private photos visible to friends and family), 5 (completely private photos)

param.name: hbox
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of 4 values defining the Bounding Box of the area that will be searched. See API docs for more info.

param.name: accuracy
param.doc: Recorded accuracy level of the location information. Current range is 1-16: World level is 1, Country is ~3, Region is ~6, City is ~11, Street is ~16. Defaults to maximum value if not specified.

param.name: safe_search
param.doc: Safe search setting. Accepted values: 1 (safe), 2 (moderate), 3 (restricted)

param.name: content_type
param.doc: Content type setting. Accepted values: 1 (photos only), 2 (screenshots only), 3 ('other' only), 4 (photos and screenshots), 5 (screenshots and 'other'), 6 (photos and 'other'), 7 (photos, screenshots, and 'other') (all)

param.name: machine_tags
param.doc: Machine tag(s). See API docs for format. Multiple machine tags may be queried by passing a comma-separated list. The number of machine tags you can pass in a single query depends on the tag mode (AND or OR) that you are querying with. "AND" queries are limited to (16) machine tags. "OR" queries are limited to (8).

param.name: machine_tag_mode
param.doc: Either 'any' for an OR combination of tags, or 'all' for an AND combination. Defaults to 'any' if not specified.

param.name: group_id
param.doc: The id of a group who's pool to search. If specified, only matching photos posted to the group's pool will be returned.

param.name: contacts
param.doc: Search your contacts. Either 'all' or 'ff' for just friends and family. (Experimental)

param.name: woe_id
param.doc: A 32-bit identifier that uniquely represents spatial entities. (not used if bbox argument is present). See API docs for more info.

param.name: place_id
param.doc: A Flickr place id. (not used if bbox argument is present). See API docs for more info.

param.name: media
param.doc: Filter results by media type. Possible values are all (default), photos, videos

param.name: has_geo
param.doc: Any photo that has been geotagged, or if the value is "0" any photo that has not been geotagged. See API docs for more info.

param.name: geo_context
param.doc: Geo context is a numeric value representing the photo's geotagginess beyond latitude and longitude. See API docs for more info. Accepted values: 0 (not defined), 1 (indoors), 2 (outdoors)

param.name: lat
param.doc: A valid latitude, in decimal format, for doing radial geo queries. See API docs for more info.

param.name: lon
param.doc: A valid longitude, in decimal format, for doing radial geo queries. See API docs for more info.

param.name: radius
param.doc: A valid radius used for geo queries, greater than zero and less than 20 miles (or 32 kilometers), for use with point-based geo queries. The default value is 5 (km).

param.name: radius_units
param.doc: The unit of measure when doing radial geo queries. Valid options are "mi" (miles) and "km" (kilometers). The default is "km".

param.name: is_commons
param.doc: Limit the scope of the search to only photos that are part of the Flickr Commons project. Default is false.

param.name: is_gallery
param.doc: Limit the scope of the search to only photos that are in a gallery? Default is false, search all photos.

param.name: is_getty
param.doc: Limit the scope of the search to only photos that are for sale on Getty. Default is false.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Correct the places hierarchy for all the photos for a user at a given latitude, longitude and accuracy. Batch corrections are processed in a delayed queue so it may take a few minutes before the changes are reflected in a user's photos.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: lat
param.doc: The latitude of the photos to be updated whose valid range is -90 to 90. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

param.name: lon
param.doc: The longitude of the photos to be updated whose valid range is -180 to 180. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

param.name: accuracy
param.doc: Recorded accuracy level of the photos to be updated. World level is 1, Country is ~3, Region ~6, City ~11, Street ~16. Current range is 1-16. Defaults to 16 if not specified.

param.name: place_id
param.doc: A Flickr Places ID. (While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

param.name: woe_id
param.doc: A Where on Earch (WOE) ID. (While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

param.doc: Context is a numeric value representing the photo's geotagginess beyond latitude and longitude. For example, you may wish to indicate that a photo was taken "indoors" or "outdoors". The current list of context IDs is: 0 (not defined), 1 (indoors), 2 (outdoors). The default context for geotagged photos is 0, or "not defined".

method.name: POST
method.doc: Sets the geo data (latitude and longitude and, optionally, the accuracy level) for a photo. Before users may assign location data to a photo they must define who, by default, may view that information. Users can edit this preference at http://www.flickr.com/account/geo/privacy/. If a user has not set this preference, the API method will return an error.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.doc: The id of the photo you want to retrieve location data for.

param.doc: The latitude whose valid range is -90 to 90. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

param.name: lon
param.doc: The longitude whose valid range is -180 to 180. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

param.name: accuracy
param.doc: Recorded accuracy level of the location information. World level is 1, Country is ~3, Region ~6, City ~11, Street ~16. Current range is 1-16. Defaults to 16 if not specified.

param.name: context
param.doc: Context is a numeric value representing the photo's geotagginess beyond latitude and longitude. For example, you may wish to indicate that a photo was taken "indoors" or "outdoors". The current list of context IDs is: 0 (not defined), 1 (indoors), 2 (outdoors). The default context for geotagged photos is 0, or "not defined".

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: bbox
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of 4 values defining the Bounding Box of the area that will be searched. The 4 values represent the bottom-left corner of the box and the top-right corner, minimum_longitude, minimum_latitude, maximum_longitude, maximum_latitude.

param.name: place_type_id
param.doc: The numeric ID for a specific place type to cluster photos by. Valid place type IDs are: 22 (neighborhood), 7 (locality), 8 (region), 12 (country), 29 (continent).

param.name: place_type
param.doc: Deprecated in favor of place_type_id. The name of place type to using as the starting point to search for places in a bounding box. Valid placetypes are: neighbourhood, locality, county, region, country, continent.

method.name: GET

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.doc: The numeric ID for a specific place type to cluster photos by. Valid place type IDs are: 22 (neighborhood), 7 (locality), 8 (region), 12 (country), 29 (continent).

param.name: place_type
param.doc: Deprecated in favor of place_type_id. The name of place type to using as the starting point to search for places in a bounding box. Valid placetypes are: neighbourhood, locality, county, region, country, continent.

param.name: woe_id
param.doc: A Where on Earth (WOE) identifier to use to filter photo clusters. (While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

param.name: place_id
param.doc: A Flickr Places identifier to use to filter photo clusters. (While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

param.name: threshold
param.doc: The minimum number of photos that a place type must have to be included. If the number of photos is lowered then the parent place type for that place will be used.

param.name: contacts
param.doc: Search your contacts. Either 'all' or 'ff' for just friends and family. (Default is all)

param.name: min_upload_date
param.doc: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: max_upload_date
param.doc: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: min_taken_date
param.doc: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

param.name: max_taken_date
param.doc: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Return a list of the top 100 unique places clustered by a given placetype for set of tags or machine tags.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: place_type_id
param.doc: The numeric ID for a specific place type to cluster photos by. Valid place type IDs are: 22 (neighborhood), 7 (locality), 8 (region), 12 (country), 29 (continent).

param.doc: A Where on Earth (WOE) identifier to use to filter photo clusters. (While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

param.name: place_id
param.doc: A Flickr Places identifier to use to filter photo clusters. (While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

param.name: threshold
param.doc: The minimum number of photos that a place type must have to be included. If the number of photos is lowered then the parent place type for that place will be used.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of tags. Photos with one or more of the tags listed will be returned.

param.name: tag_mode
param.doc: Either 'any' for an OR combination of tags, or 'all' for an AND combination. Defaults to 'any' if not specified.

param.name: machine_tags
param.doc: Machine tags. See API docs for format. Multiple machine tags may be queried by passing a comma-separated list. The number of machine tags you can pass in a single query depends on the tag mode (AND or OR) that you are querying with. "AND" queries are limited to (16) machine tags. "OR" queries are limited to (8).

param.name: machine_tag_mode
param.doc: Either 'any' for an OR combination of tags, or 'all' for an AND combination. Defaults to 'any' if not specified.

param.name: min_upload_date
param.doc: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: max_upload_date
param.doc: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: min_taken_date
param.doc: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

param.name: max_taken_date
param.doc: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get a list of referring domains for a collection

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: date
param.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day.

param.name: collection_id
param.doc: The id of the collection to get stats for. If not provided, stats for all collections will be returned.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get a list of referrers from a given domain to a collection

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: date
param.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day.

param.name: domain
param.doc: The domain to return referrers for. This should be a hostname (eg: "flickr.com") with no protocol or pathname.

param.name: collection_id
param.doc: The id of the collection to get stats for. If not provided, stats for all collections will be returned.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: GET
method.doc: List the photos with the most views, comments or favorites.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

param.name: date
param.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day. If no date is provided, all time view counts will be returned.

param.name: sort
param.doc: The order in which to sort returned photos. Defaults to views. The possible values are views, comments and favorites. Other sort options are available through flickr.photos.search.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.
